headline.main: Studies Find Smokers More Prone to Depression Than Nonsmokers

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Smokers are more likely than nonsmokers to have suffered from depression, and severe depression seems to make it extremely difficult for smokers to quit, according to two studies being reported today.
docs.snippet: LEAD: Smokers are more likely than nonsmokers to have suffered from depression, and severe depression seems to make it extremely difficult for smokers to quit, according to two studies being reported today.

headline.main: U.S. Cites List of Gains From Quitting Smoking

byline.original: By PHILIP J. HILTS, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Surgeon General said today that there were ''major and immediate'' benefits from quitting smoking even for older people and that insurers should pay for programs to help people quit.
docs.snippet: LEAD: The Surgeon General said today that there were ''major and immediate'' benefits from quitting smoking even for older people and that insurers should pay for programs to help people quit.
